  "Broker Comment" : "SETTLED BY CREDIT TO CUSTOMERS ACCOUNT OF $17,533.90 NASD INVESTIGATED THE MATTER AND TERMINATION FROM MERRILL LYNCH, HOLD ON MY REGISTRATION WAS RELEASED. THE NASD DETERMINED THAT NO ACTION WAS WARRANTED. ON 3/13/1990, A CUSTOMER COMPLAINT WAS INITIATED BY [CUSTOMER], WHO DEMANDED THAT A ZERO COUPON CERTIFICATE OF DEPOSIT WHICH WAS SOLD TO HIM WHILE I WAS EMPLOYED AT MERRILL LYNCH BE PAID TO HIS FACE VALUE OF $100,000 AS SUBSEQUENTLY THE BANK WHICH HAD ISSUED THIS CD (FDIC INSURED) HAD GONE BANKRUPT AND WAS TAKEN OVER BY THE RESOLUTION TRUST CORPORATION (RTC). MY UNDERSTANDING OF THE SETTLEMENT OF THIS MATTER IS THAT MERRILL LYNCH SIMPLY SAW THAT THE ACREATED VALUE  OF HIS C.D. $17,533.90 WAS PAID TO HIS ACCOUNT BY THE RTC. THIS MATTER WAS FULLY INVESTIGATED BY THE NASD WHICH FOUND NO CAUSE FOR ACTION."
